wikitext.*:
The '''Long List of the Ents'''<ref>{{RK|I1}}</ref> was a song of lore known to the [[Ents]] that listed every living creature known to them. It is a poem-list spoken by [[Treebeard]] on [[29 February]] {{TA|3019}},<ref name=Great>{{App|Great}}</ref> to [[Meriadoc Brandybuck|Merry]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]]. 

The list must be very ancient, as Treebeard stated that he had learned it whilst he was still young. It is potentially much longer than what is recited here.

==Poem==
[[File:Alan Lee - Treebeard 2.jpg|200px|thumb|"Treebeard" by [[Alan Lee]]]]
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Learn now the lore of Living Creatures!
First name the four, the free peoples:
Eldest of all, the elf-children;
Dwarf the delver, dark are his houses;
Ent the earthborn, old as mountains;
Man the mortal, master of horses:

Beaver the builder, buck the leaper,
Bear bee-hunter, boar the fighter;
Hound is hungry, hare is fearful...

Eagle in eyrie, ox in pasture,
Hart horn-crown√©d; hawk is swiftest,
Swan the whitest, serpent coldest...
</poem>

Pippin suggested adding Hobbits on a new line; ''Half-grown hobbits, the hole-dwellers'' and that it should go next to [[Men|Man]], to which Treebeard thought the suggestion was ''"Not bad, not bad"''.<ref>{{TT|III4}}</ref>
After the parley with [[Saruman]] at [[Isengard]] on [[5 March]],<ref name=Great/> Treebeard revealed that he had indeed added Hobbits to the Long List: 
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Ents the earthborn, old as mountains,
the wide-walkers, water drinking;
and hungry as hunters, the Hobbit children,
the laughing-folk, the little people,<ref>{{TT|III10}}</ref>
</poem>
